text: The 1905 FA Cup Final was contested by Aston Villa and Newcastle United at Crystal Palace. Aston Villa were victorious, winning 2–0, with Harry Hampton scoring both goals. ==Match details== Harry Hampton scores one of his two goals in the final {| width="92%" | |- | | |} {| width="100%" | valign="top" width="50%" | {| style="font-size: 90%" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" | colspan="4" | |- ! width="25" | !! width="25" | |- | || || Billy George |- | || || Howard Spencer (c) |- | || || Alf Miles |- | || || Joe Pearson |- | || || Alex Leake |- | || || Jack Windmill |- | || || Billy Brawn |- | || || Billy Garraty |- | || || Harry Hampton |- | || || Joe Bache |- | || || Bert Hall |- | colspan="4" |Secretary-Manager: |- | colspan="4" | George Ramsay |} | valign="top" width="50%" | {| style="font-size: 90%" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" align="center" | colspan="4" | |- ! width="25" | !! width="25" | |- | || || Jimmy Lawrence |- | || || Andy McCombie |- | || || Jack Carr |- | || || Alex Gardner |- | || || Andy Aitken |- | || || Peter McWilliam |- | || || Jock Rutherford |- | || || James Howie |- | || || Bill Appleyard |- | || || Colin Veitch (c) |- | || || Bert Gosnell |- | colspan="4" |Manager: |- | colspan="4" | Frank Watt |} |} {| width=100% style="font-size: 90%" | width=50% valign=top| Match rules * 90 minutes. * 30 minutes of extra-time if necessary. * Replay if scores still level. |} ==References== 1905 Category:1904–05 in English football Category:Aston Villa F.C. matches Category:Newcastle United F.C. matches Category:April 1905 sports events
title: 1905 FA Cup Final
